column3: private

column1: Join us at the Spy Museum Store and uncover the world of espionage and intelligence from people who practiced professionally. R. Scott Decker
column2: Phd
column3: retired from the FBI as a supervisory special agent at the end of 2011
column4: after 22 years of service. He spent his early FBI career in pursuit of bank and armored car robbers throughout Boston. On September 12
column6: he led a team of FBI hazmat specialists to Ground Zero in New York City
column7: and then joined the developing Amerithrax Task Force against the anthrax threat. Decker coordinated the early genetics and DNA forensics of the bioterror investigation
column8: and supervised a squad of agents whose work charted new ground and established the discipline of microbial forensics.

column1: The shadow world of spying has captured the imagination of authors for centuries. Now
column2: you can be the one to develop the plot and storyline that grips readers' attention and quickens their pulses. Join Melissa Mahle
column3: former CIA intelligence officer and author of Anatolia Steppe: Lost in Petra and Camp Secret
column4: and discover how her skills as a real former spy helped her develop characters and stories for her book. Combining writing with hands-on work in disguise
column7: this unique writing workshop for young spies reveals the process of creating intriguing characters and spine-tingling stories. After all the missions are completed successfully
column8: who knows… you might just have the beginnings of your very own spy novel. Ages: 9-14* | No Grownups Allowed! **Dinner included. Space is limited-advance registration required.

column1: When the lights go down
column2: the adventure begins! The Museum doors have been locked for the night
column3: but in the shadows a group of exclusive recruits stand ready to begin a night of top-secret KidSpy® training. This could be you! Perfect your alias and cover-story
column4: check in at “Border Patrol
column5: ” and prepare for a night of intrigue and adventure. As a spy school recruit
column6: your mission begins with taking on a secret identity and gathering intelligence about real spy skills. During the night
column7: you will transform yourself through disguise
column11: and hunt for a mole within your ranks! At the same time
column12: the adults lurking nearby will be kept on their toes with their own super-clandestine mission. As day breaks
column13: enemy agents will be exposed in a dramatic finale
column14: KidSpy agents and adults will reclaim their “real” (how do we know you are who you say you are?) identities and this adventure-filled mission will be accomplished. Operation Secret Sleepover is designed for kids age 9-13.

column1: Be the first to learn the latest intelligence news! Join David Major
column2: retired supervisory special agent of the FBI and former director of Counterintelligence and Security Programs at the NSC staff at the White House
column3: for a briefing on the hottest intelligence and security issues
column4: breaches
column5: and penetrations. Presented in partnership with The Centre for Counterintelligence and Security Studies (CI Centre)
column6: these updates will cover worldwide events such as breaking espionage cases and arrest reports
column8: and terrorist activity. Major uses his expertise to analyze trends and highlight emerging issues of interest to both intelligence and national security professionals and the public. Cases are drawn from the CI Centre’s SPYPEDIA®
column9: the most comprehensive source of espionage information in the world
column10: containing events and information that may not be reported by mainstream media outlets.

column1: Join us at the Spy Museum Store and meet an F-4 pilot. Mark A. Hewitt has always had a fascination with spyplanes and the intelligence community’s development and use of aircraft. He flew F-4s in the Marine Corps and served as Director of Maintenance with the Border Patrol and the Air Force
column2: as was an Associate Professor for Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University. He is the author of "Special Access"
column3: "Shoot Down" “No Need to Know” and his latest
column4: "Blown Cover".  His novels have been approved by the CIA Publication Review Board.
